intro: Gymnemopsis, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of a single species, Gymnemopsis monticola, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap, which can be toxic. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are small and clustered. Gymnemopsis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
